meanings.definition: A large flightless bird native to New Zealand.
meanings.sent1: The moas roamed freely in the forests of New Zealand.
meanings.sent2: I learned about moas in my science class.
meanings.sent3: Why did the moas refuse to play hide and seek? Because they were always too big to hide!
meanings.sent4: The moas stood tall like ancient guardians of the land.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the majestic moas left a lasting impression on the explorers.

meanings.definition: The plural form of 'moa', referring to more than one of these birds.
meanings.sent1: We saw a group of moas wandering in the grasslands.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed skeletons of moas found in different regions.
meanings.sent3: Why did the moas throw a party? To celebrate their flock's reunion!
meanings.sent4: The sky darkened as the moas filled the horizon with their presence.
meanings.sent5: The abundance of moas signaled a thriving ecosystem in the past.
